Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
mooch \mooch\ v. t. 1. to ask for and get free; to borrow without intending to repay; to sponge; -- usually with objects of small value; as, he mooched a few cigarettes from me.
Syn: bum, cadge, grub, sponge. [WordNet 1.5]
2. To beg for. [PJC]
mooch v : ask for and get free; be a parasite [syn: {bum}, {cadge}, {grub}, {sponge}]
